materials.raw_text: Co: 30 g, Cu: 50 g, In: 20 g, La: 80 g

sourcing.instructions: Co: Metal suppliers or online chemical distributors; Cu: Local hardware stores or metal suppliers; In: Specialty metal suppliers or online chemical distributors; La: Rare earth material suppliers or online chemical distributors.
steps: Co: Metal suppliers or online chemical distributors; Cu: Local hardware stores or metal suppliers; In: Specialty metal suppliers or online chemical distributors; La: Rare earth material suppliers or online chemical distributors.

1. Measure 30 g of cobalt (Co) powder. 2. Measure 50 g of copper (Cu) powder. 3. Measure 20 g of indium (In) powder. 4. Measure 80 g of lanthanum (La) powder. 5. Combine all powders in a clean, dry mixing container. 6. Mix thoroughly using a mechanical mixer for 15 minutes to ensure uniform distribution.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 30 g of cobalt (Co) powder. 2. Measure 50 g of copper (Cu) powder. 3. Measure 20 g of indium (In) powder. 4. Measure 80 g of lanthanum (La) powder. 5. Combine all powders in a clean, dry mixing container. 6. Mix thoroughly using a mechanical mixer for 15 minutes to ensure uniform distribution.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible. 2. Preheat the furnace to 800°C. 3. Place the crucible in the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to facilitate reaction and fusion of materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible. 2. Preheat the furnace to 800°C. 3. Place the crucible in the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to facilitate reaction and fusion of materials.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. If necessary, grind the sample to achieve a uniform surface using a grinder. 3. Sand the edges and surfaces to remove any sharp points or irregularities. 4. Optionally, seal the material with a clear coating to protect it from oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. If necessary, grind the sample to achieve a uniform surface using a grinder. 3. Sand the edges and surfaces to remove any sharp points or irregularities. 4. Optionally, seal the material with a clear coating to protect it from oxidation.
